pull.title: Compact Block Tweaks
pull.body: As I'm avoiding code churn in #8068, any further changes which are not required for correct operation will be dumped here.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Bitcoin (dont fork from here, fork from bitcoin/bitcoin)

issue.title: Compact Blocks
issue.body:
This is based on #8020 and implements the BIP 152 draft from https://github.com/TheBlueMatt/bips/blob/152/bip-0152.mediawiki.

In short, it sends blocks as a set of short transaction IDs to allow nodes to not double-relay transactions in blocks. There are lots of details in both the BIP and the discussion on the bitcoin-dev ML.

There are still some TODOs in the code here, but I do not think they are blockers for this, as they are not protocol-level changes and can be implemented separately to make the protocol more effecient.

events.message: Dont remove a "preferred" cmpctblock peer if they provide a block
More agressively filter compact block requests
Add cmpctblock to debug help list

@TheBlueMatt Feel like adapting the tests from #8418 to not fail here?
What is the status of this?

issue.title: Compact Block Tweaks (rebase of #8235)
issue.body: This is a rebase of #8235, with unit tests from #8418 adapted, and some comments addressed.

issue.title: Backport compact blocks functionality from bitcoin
issue.body:
Backport compact blocks functionality ([BIP152](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0152.mediawiki)). 

Dash doesn't support SegWit, so Compact Blocks has version 1, but supports not SegWit-related features of Bitcoin Compact Blocks version 2.

Merged BTC PRs:
